More Notes: A 25% reduction in early-life ozone exposure is associated with an increase in per person discounted lifetime earnings. The result scaled to a national level equates to a 2% increase of 2005 GDP, or $2.05 billion.
Increase per person if early-life pollution exposure was reduced by 25 percent.
Increase in the province (Cebu) if early-life pollution exposure was reduced by 25 percent.
Increase at the national level if early-life pollution exposure was reduced by 25 percent.
Percentage of 2005 GDP, increase if early-life pollution exposure was reduced by 25 percent.
The GDP benefit is associated with reducing O3 exposures by 25% and represents 2% of the Philippine GDP in 2005.
